definitions: soft gentle wind from the west especially in spring and summer
very thin lightweight fabric often made of cotton or wool
examples: A pleasant zephyr rustled through the palm trees
The afternoon zephyr cooled the beach nicely
Her summer dress was made of delicate zephyr
The curtains were fashioned from white zephyr fabric

definitions: large rigid airship with internal gas cells filled with hydrogen or helium
examples: The zeppelin floated majestically above the city skyline
During World War I zeppelins were used for bombing raids

definitions: landlocked country in southern Africa bordered by South Africa and Zambia
examples: Zimbabwe gained independence from Britain in 1980
Victoria Falls is located between Zimbabwe and Zambia

definitions: native or inhabitant of Zimbabwe or relating to the country
examples: Many Zimbabweans have emigrated to neighboring countries
The Zimbabwean economy faced significant challenges recently

definitions: black grape variety grown especially in California for winemaking
robust red wine made from zinfandel grapes with fruity flavor
examples: Zinfandel grapes thrive in California's warm climate
The vineyard specializes in growing old vine zinfandel
She ordered a glass of zinfandel with dinner
This zinfandel pairs well with barbecued meats

definitions: hill in Jerusalem where the city of David was built in biblical times
place regarded as holy or as a promised land especially by religious groups
examples: Mount Zion holds great significance in Jewish history
Pilgrims traveled to Zion for religious observances
They viewed America as their new Zion
The movement sought to establish Zion in Palestine

definitions: political movement supporting the establishment and development of a Jewish homeland in Israel
examples: Zionism emerged in the late nineteenth century Europe
Theodore Herzl is considered the father of modern Zionism

definitions: person who supports or advocates for the establishment and development of a Jewish homeland
examples: Many early Zionists immigrated to Palestine from Europe
The Zionist congress met annually to plan settlement activities

definitions: ancient Persian prophet and founder of Zoroastrianism who lived around 600 BCE
examples: Zoroaster preached the worship of Ahura Mazda
The teachings of Zoroaster influenced later monotheistic religions

definitions: person who follows Zoroastrianism or relating to this ancient Persian religion
examples: Many Zoroastrians fled to India after the Arab conquest
The Zoroastrian community maintains sacred fire temples

definitions: ancient Persian religion founded by Zoroaster based on worship of Ahura Mazda and cosmic dualism
examples: Zoroastrianism influenced the development of Judaism and Christianity
Fire plays a central role in Zoroastrianism rituals

definitions: member of a South African people living mainly in KwaZulu-Natal province
Bantu language spoken by the Zulu people in southern Africa
examples: The Zulu kingdom was established by Shaka in the 1800s
Many Zulu traditions continue in modern South Africa
She studied Zulu at the University of Natal
Zulu uses click consonants in its sound system

definitions: largest city in Switzerland located on Lake Zurich serving as a major financial center
examples: Zurich hosts many international banking headquarters
The train from Geneva to Zurich takes three hours

definitions: nocturnal burrowing mammal native to Africa with long snout for eating ants and termites
examples: The aardvark uses its powerful claws to dig burrows
Aardvarks can eat thousands of termites each night

definitions: large marine snail with ear-shaped shell prized as seafood found along rocky coasts
examples: Divers harvest abalone from the ocean floor carefully
The restaurant serves grilled abalone as a delicacy

definitions: act of leaving someone or something permanently without intending to return
complete lack of inhibition or restraint in behavior or emotion
examples: The abandonment of the village occurred during the war
Child abandonment is a serious criminal offense
She danced with wild abandonment at the celebration
He threw himself into the project with reckless abandonment

definitions: process of reducing or lessening in amount intensity or degree especially of something harmful
examples: The city ordered noise abatement measures near airports
Tax abatement programs encourage business development downtown

definitions: building where animals are killed and processed for meat consumption
examples: The abattoir processes hundreds of cattle each day
Health inspectors regularly check conditions at the abattoir

definitions: full-length loose black robe worn by some Muslim women covering the entire body
examples: She wore an embroidered abaya to the wedding ceremony
The abaya is commonly worn in Saudi Arabia

definitions: building or group of buildings housing monks or nuns under religious vows
examples: Westminster Abbey hosts royal ceremonies and coronations
The medieval abbey ruins attract many tourists annually

definitions: man who is head of an abbey of monks with spiritual and administrative authority
examples: The abbot led morning prayers in the chapel
Brother Francis was elected abbot by the monks

definitions: shortened form of a word or phrase used to represent the full form
examples: USA is an abbreviation for United States of America
Medical records often contain numerous abbreviations for efficiency

definitions: formal giving up of monarchical power or any position of authority and responsibility
examples: King Edward's abdication shocked the British nation in 1936
The CEO's sudden abdication left the company in turmoil

definitions: muscle in the front part of the body between chest and pelvis
examples: Daily abdominal exercises strengthen your core muscles effectively
The surgeon examined the patient's abdominal area carefully

definitions: illegal taking away of a person by force or deception
movement of a limb or body part away from the midline of the body
examples: The police investigated the child abduction case immediately
Alien abduction stories appear frequently in science fiction
Abduction of the arm involves lifting it sideways
The physical therapist tested shoulder abduction range

definitions: person who illegally takes someone away by force or deception
muscle that moves a body part away from the body's midline
examples: The abductor demanded ransom for the victim's release
Police arrested the suspected abductor within forty-eight hours
The hip abductor helps stabilize walking and running
Strengthen your abductor muscles with lateral leg raises

definitions: person or thing that deviates from what is normal or expected in behavior
examples: The scientist studied aberrants in the population sample
Social aberrants often face discrimination and misunderstanding

definitions: departure from what is normal usual or expected typically unwelcome
failure of rays to converge at one focus because of lens defects
examples: His violent outburst was an aberration in behavior
The data showed a statistical aberration requiring investigation
The telescope's aberration produced blurry images of stars
Chromatic aberration creates color fringing in photographs

definitions: state of temporary disuse or suspension while awaiting further action or decision
examples: The project was held in abeyance pending funding approval
Legal proceedings remain in abeyance until evidence emerges

definitions: surgical removal of body tissue especially by cutting or laser
removal of material from a surface by erosion melting or vaporization
examples: Cardiac ablation treats irregular heart rhythm problems effectively
The tumor required complete ablation to prevent spreading
Glacier ablation increases during warm summer months significantly
Heat shield ablation protects spacecraft during atmospheric reentry

definitions: ceremonial washing of hands face or body especially for religious purposes
examples: Muslims perform ablutions before their daily prayers begin
The priest completed his ablutions before the morning service

definitions: quality or state of being abnormal or something that deviates from what is normal
examples: Doctors detected a fetal abnormality during routine screening
The blood test revealed no abnormalities in cell count

definitions: place where someone lives especially as a formal or literary term for home
examples: Welcome to my humble abode in the countryside
The hermit's abode was hidden deep within the forest

definitions: act of formally putting an end to a system practice or institution
examples: The abolishment of slavery required constitutional amendments nationwide
Citizens celebrated the abolishment of unfair taxation laws

definitions: action of abolishing a system practice or institution especially slavery
examples: The abolition of slavery transformed American society fundamentally
Prison abolition advocates propose alternative justice systems

definitions: political movement seeking to end slavery and other forms of human bondage
examples: Abolitionism gained momentum in the nineteenth century rapidly
Frederick Douglass became a powerful voice for abolitionism

definitions: person who advocates for the ending of slavery or similar practices
examples: Harriet Tubman was a famous abolitionist and conductor
Abolitionists risked their lives operating the Underground Railroad

definitions: thing that causes disgust or hatred especially something morally reprehensible
examples: They considered the new law an abomination against justice
The abandoned factory had become an architectural abomination

definitions: original inhabitant of a land especially relating to Australian indigenous peoples
examples: Aboriginal Australians have lived there for sixty thousand years
The museum displays traditional aboriginal art and artifacts

definitions: instance of stopping something before completion especially a mission or process
examples: The mission abort saved the astronauts from disaster
A system abort prevented the corrupted file installation

definitions: area where skin has been scraped or worn away by rubbing
process of wearing something down through friction or rubbing
examples: The nurse cleaned the abrasion on his knee
Minor abrasions heal quickly with proper care
Rock abrasion created smooth surfaces over millennia
Tire abrasion leaves rubber particles on road surfaces

definitions: substance used for grinding polishing or cleaning a hard surface
examples: Sandpaper contains abrasive particles for smoothing wood
Industrial abrasives remove rust from metal surfaces

definitions: formal abolition or annulment of a law agreement or custom by authority
examples: The abrogation of the treaty surprised diplomatic observers
Constitutional abrogation requires specific legal procedures

definitions: person who is absent from a place where they are expected to be
examples: The teacher marked three absentees in the attendance register
Absentee landlords rarely visit their rental properties

definitions: practice of regularly staying away from work or school without good reason
examples: High absenteeism rates affect company productivity significantly
The school implemented policies to reduce student absenteeism
